thread.title: Promising Syracuse Crunch rookie out at least a month
thread.title_full: Promising Syracuse Crunch rookie out at least a month

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: Promising Syracuse Crunch rookie out at least a month
text:
Promising Syracuse Crunch rookie out at least a month 2015-10-17-ss-Crunch_23.JPG Syracuse Crunch rookie forward Adam Erne has one assist in four games for the team this season. (Scott Schild | Sschild@syracuse.com) Comments 
The Syracuse Crunch's run of bad luck has begun early this season. 
Rookie forward Adam Erne is expected to miss at least four or five weeks after suffering an upper body injury in Friday's loss to Hartford. 
Crunch coach Rob Zettler confirmed the news to broadcaster Dan D'Uva before the Crunch's game at Utica on Saturday. 
Erne was a second-round pick by Tampa Bay in the 2013 draft. Skating on the Crunch's top line this season, he had one helper in four games.
